description: From Anglo-Norman adjoindre, from Latin adiung≈ç.

verbs.description: adjoin (third-person singular simple present adjoins, present participle adjoining, simple past and past participle adjoined)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To be in contact or connection with.
examples: The living room and dining room adjoin each other.

entries.meaning: (transitive, mathematics, chiefly algebra and number theory) To extend an algebraic object (e.g. a field, a ring, etc.) by adding to it (an element not belonging to it) and all finite power series of (the element).
